Not the cheapest but a nice atmosphere and generous portions. The waiting staff were very helpful.

Author: vektor57;

Hank did it again! A beautiful restaurant and Bulldog experience in one of the most historical plazas in Rome! Great drinks as well!

Author: J T;
Rating: 4
When: 2 years ago
Interesting place. Seemed to be a chain, which isn't as common in Italy as it is here. We didn't eat anything, just had drinks. Drinks were fine, but it's more of a bar for beer and sports. It satisfied though since we were stopping every so often to grab a drink and snack before we moved on to the next place.

Author: Steve Lipp;
Rating: 5
When: 2 years ago
Nice, cosmopolitan place with local and international brews and drinks. Didn't try burgers but they look delicious. Crew is very hospitable. Would recommend.

Author: Matt Smith;
Rating: 5
When: 10 months ago
Hope the staff and bartender Luana are doing well....great bar!!!

Roma Beer Company - Campo de' Fiori
Rating: 4.0

264
Quotes:
[]Author: Balázs Krucsó;
Rating: 5
When: 8 months ago
We took a beer and a prosecco there. Both of them were absolutely delightful and also we chatted a lot with the algerian waitress, whos has a very unique life story on Campo de’ Fiori. Definitely recommend to get the place and drink a bit and talk with the employees. You will not regret it!

Author: Rok Bergman;
Rating: 3
When: 10 months ago
Good food and good beer selecetion.

Author: Mr JoneZ;
Rating: 5
When: 10 months ago
The food was very delicious and the waiters were very friendly. We recommend this place

Author: Heloisa Lopes;
Rating: 2
When: a year ago
We were attracted here during Happy Hour, I asked which beers were in Happy Hour, it was two. But they did not told us it was only 0,4L, so we asked 1L and it was not in Happy Hour, and we only discovered that while we were paying (they omitted the information, although I specifically asked which beers were included in Happy Hour). Besides that, they charged us for 2L of the beer that costs 14 euros, but we asked 1L of the 14 euros beer and 1L of the 12 euros beer. They subtracted the 2 euros, but complaining until the very end.

Author: John Willemsen;
Rating: 4
When: 9 months ago
The aperitivo dish was okay, the beer not bad but also nothing special, the waiter (the Albanian one) was very friendly, charming and added nice vibes to our evening. If I went back, it would be because of him.

[]Author: Jennifer Friedrich;
Rating: 5
When: a year ago
What a fabulous find in Rome! Completely charming and fascinating cocktail bar- vintage decor with lots of wild taxidermy! The drinks were delicious and the staff friendly- go check them out!

Author: neaux bodi;
Rating: 1
When: a year ago
Had an awful experience here. Walked in and ordered a drink then went to find a seat. Ended up walking into a room we weren't supposed to be in I guess, even though there was no sign or door to stop us, the owner rushed us out then proceeded to scream at the bartender until she cried. Very very awkward situation. We quickly paid for our 3 drinks, which was €40, and got out of there. DO NOT GO TO THIS BAR!

Author: Sokol Elmazaj;
Rating: 5
When: a year ago
Lovely cocktail bar. You have to try this. Do not miss the Churchill.

Author: Yana Osinsky;
Rating: 5
When: a year ago
One of the best and craziest cocktail bars I have been in. If you visit Rome, you must visit this place! Enjoy...

Author: Mr GillyFlower;
Rating: 5
When: a year ago
Fantastic experience, warm welcoming from the staff and a great atmosphere. Lovely cocktails! Would recommend to everyone.

[]Author: Ghazzal Mehdi;
Rating: 5
When: 9 months ago
Surely a five star place. Perhaps the most iconic in Rome? To be honest, Rome has so many iconic places that I lost the count... Anyway, near to. Vetican, great bridges.. Simply outstanding...

Author: Marcos Chavarria;
Rating: 4
When: 2 months ago
Greater sight from the outside, I hope the pictures make sense of the very nice place this is. The architecture is different from other landmarks as it was intended for a different purpose in the religious history. Prepare to walk a lot. I would recommend the walking tour if possible.

Author: Marcel van Poeijer;
Rating: 4
When: 4 months ago
This huge Castle is definitely worth a visit. Even though I did not go in (entrance fee = 15EU), I still loved the outside area and the little park next to it. When you go inside, it is recommended to go before sunrise, as the sunrise view on top of the terrace should be lovely.

Author: Ken Saberi;
Rating: 4
When: 7 months ago
Great place to visit with spectacular views all around Rome. Interesting artefacts and some Papal history to see. Some of the rooms are stunning. There are a lot of stairs so people with mobility issues may struggle although there is a lift to the second level which can be used on request. This does mean that you will lose out on the top terrace which provides the best views. All the staff were extremely helpful and kind.

Author: Rich;
Rating: 3
When: 8 months ago
A fine visit. The best thing about this castle is the view you get once you're on the top floor.

[]Author: M in Paris;
Rating: 3
When: 2 months ago
The building is amazing and especially on the third floor there is a very interesting little exhibition of the evolution of the Roman architecture. The second floor you'll find a little bit of history of the clergy and romans aristocracy through the centuries but no ground breaking paintings.

Author: Dominic Arbuthnott;
Rating: 4
When: 9 months ago
Great view from top floor

Author: Vijay Sisodia;
Rating: 4
When: a year ago
Nice little museum. (Be warned that it isn't very big so don't expect to spend more than a few hours here.) Information is multilingual Staff are friendly Has seating area in almost every room. Has good interactive videos explaining the history of Rome. For those with a Roma pass, you still have to go to the ticket office to get your tickets.

Author: David naftalis;
Rating: 2
When: 9 months ago
Museum with variable exhibitions. Not pricy. The staff not welcoming and very not patience...

Author: Tony Popa;
Rating: 5
When: a year ago
The Museo di Roma is a museum in Rome, Italy, part of the network of Roman civic museums. The museum was founded in the Fascist era with the aim of documenting the local history and traditions of the "old Rome" that was rapidly disappearing, but following many donations and acquisitions of works of art is now principally an art museum. The collections initially included 120 water-colours by the nineteenth-century painter Ettore Roesler Franz of Roma sparita, "vanished Rome", later moved to the Museo di Roma in Trastevere.

[]Author: Thibaut De Vriendt;
Rating: 4
When: 8 months ago
If you are under 25 years old it is €2. Good scenic view on top of the Castle.

Author: Shelby Elkins;
Rating: 5
When: 2 months ago
The park is free to access and has some very nice views! There are plenty of benches to sit on and relax. People also ride their bikes, play with their dogs, and eat snacks from nearby food trucks. Highly recommend!

Author: Joeni Arianto Kurniawan;
Rating: 5
When: 3 months ago
A pleasant park, very comfortable for exercise, at the center of Rome.

Author: Mateusz Ciarkowski;
Rating: 5
When: 8 months ago
Really nice park to have a night walk with your secon half, take wine with you and enjoy. On one side of the park you have massive castle Castel Sant'Angelo, on the other side you have Tyber River. Just next to the river you can find some stalls with souvenirs.

Author: Conor Kehoe;
Rating: 5
When: 7 months ago
Very nice panoramic views of the city. The park is beautiful with a lovely atmosphere inside

[]Author: Marcos Chavarria;
Rating: 5
When: 2 months ago
All comments agree in one thing. This is a beautiful square, the 4 rivers fountain is a great sight. The details and the history behind it are just marvelous. You can have a coffee. Lunch or dinner at the surrounding restaurants, have a look at the daily life at the Piazza Navona is just delightful. Recommended for all parties

Author: Shelby Elkins;
Rating: 5
When: 2 months ago
Always a pretty sight to see! Of course, Piazza Navona is free to visit. There are plenty of food options in the square and so much to see. The church is free to visit, and the three fountains are very nice. You can even talk to a psychic and learn your possible destiny!🤫

Author: Mahammad Alizada;

When: 8 months ago
Amazing

Author: Hartmut P;

Fountain made by the famous baroque artist Bernini , depicting the four great rivers of the World

Author: Regan;
Rating: 5
When: 5 months ago
The coolest back story for a fountain ever! The figures on the fountain are all covering their faces to save their eyes from the sight of a rival Architects Building adjacent. Brilliant! Incredible sculpture also and set an an impressive square.
